name: token
docs: A Token program on the Solana blockchain.
This program defines a common implementation for Fungible and Non Fungible tokens.

instructions.name: InitializeMint
docs: Initializes a new mint and optionally deposits all the newly minted
tokens in an account.
The `InitializeMint` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized
account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint to initialize.

accounts.name: $(SysVarRentPubkey)
docs: Rent sysvar.

args.name: decimals
docs: Number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

args.name: mint_authority
docs: The authority/multisignature to mint tokens.

args.name: freeze_authority
docs: The freeze authority/multisignature of the mint.

instructions.name: InitializeAccount
docs: Initializes a new account to hold tokens.  If this account is associated
with the native mint then the token balance of the initialized account
will be equal to the amount of SOL in the account. If this account is
associated with another mint, that mint must be initialized before this
command can succeed.
The `InitializeAccount` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized
account.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint this account will be associated with.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The new account's owner/multisignature.

accounts.name: $(SysVarRentPubkey)
docs: Rent sysvar.

instructions.name: InitializeMultisig
docs: Initializes a multisignature account with N provided signers.
Multisignature accounts can used in place of any single owner/delegate
accounts in any token instruction that require an owner/delegate to be
present.  The variant field represents the number of signers (M)
required to validate this multisignature account.
The `InitializeMultisig` instruction requires no signers and MUST be
included within the same Transaction as the system program's
`CreateAccount` instruction that creates the account being initialized.
Otherwise another party can acquire ownership of the uninitialized
account.

accounts.name: account
docs: The multisignature account to initialize.

accounts.name: $(SysVarRentPubkey)
docs: Rent sysvar.

accounts.name: signers
docs: ..2+N The signer accounts, must equal to N where 1 <= N <=11

args.name: m
docs: The number of signers (M) required to validate this multisignature
account.

instructions.name: Transfer
docs: Transfers tokens from one account to another either directly or via a
delegate.  If this account is associated with the native mint then equal
amounts of SOL and Tokens will be transferred to the destination
account.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner/delegate.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to transfer.

instructions.name: Approve
docs: Approves a delegate.  A delegate is given the authority over tokens on
behalf of the source account's owner.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: delegate
docs: The delegate.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens the delegate is approved for.

instructions.name: Revoke
docs: Revokes the delegate's authority.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account's owner.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

instructions.name: SetAuthority
docs: Sets a new authority of a mint or account.

accounts.name: account
docs: The mint or account to change the authority of.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The current authority of the mint or account.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: authority_type
docs: The type of authority to update.

args.name: new_authority
docs: The new authority.

instructions.name: MintTo
docs: Mints new tokens to an account.  The native mint does not support
minting.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The account to mint tokens to.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The mint's minting authority.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of new tokens to mint.

instructions.name: Burn
docs: Burns tokens by removing them from an account.  `Burn` does not support
accounts associated with the native mint, use `CloseAccount` instead.

accounts.name: source
docs: The account to burn from.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The account's owner/delegate.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to burn.

instructions.name: CloseAccount
docs: Close an account by transferring all its SOL to the destination account.
Non-native accounts may only be closed if its token amount is zero.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to close.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The account's owner.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

instructions.name: FreezeAccount
docs: Freeze an Initialized account using the Mint's freeze_authority (if set).

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to freeze.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The mint freeze authority.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

instructions.name: ThawAccount
docs: Thaw a Frozen account using the Mint's freeze_authority (if set).

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to thaw.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The mint freeze authority.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

instructions.name: TransferChecked
docs: Transfers tokens from one account to another either directly or via a
delegate.  If this account is associated with the native mint then equal
amounts of SOL and Tokens will be transferred to the destination
account.
This instruction differs from Transfer in that the token mint and
decimals value is checked by the caller.  This may be useful when
creating transactions offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The destination account.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account's owner/delegate.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to transfer.

args.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: ApproveChecked
docs: Approves a delegate.  A delegate is given the authority over tokens on
behalf of the source account's owner.
This instruction differs from Approve in that the token mint and
decimals value is checked by the caller.  This may be useful when
creating transactions offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: source
docs: The source account.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: delegate
docs: The delegate.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The source account owner.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens the delegate is approved for.

args.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: MintToChecked
docs: Mints new tokens to an account.  The native mint does not support minting.
This instruction differs from MintTo in that the decimals value is
checked by the caller.  This may be useful when creating transactions
offline or within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint.

accounts.name: destination
docs: The account to mint tokens to.

accounts.name: authority
docs: The mint's minting authority.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of new tokens to mint.

args.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: BurnChecked
docs: Burns tokens by removing them from an account.  `BurnChecked` does not
support accounts associated with the native mint, use `CloseAccount`
instead.
This instruction differs from Burn in that the decimals value is checked
by the caller. This may be useful when creating transactions offline or
within a hardware wallet.

accounts.name: source
docs: The account to burn from.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The token mint.

accounts.name: owner
docs: The account's owner/delegate.

accounts.name: signers
docs: M signer accounts.

args.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens to burn.

args.name: decimals
docs: Expected number of base 10 digits to the right of the decimal place.

instructions.name: InitializeAccount2
docs: Like InitializeAccount, but the owner pubkey is passed via instruction data
rather than the accounts list. This variant may be preferable when using
Cross Program Invocation from an instruction that does not need the owner's
`AccountInfo` otherwise.

accounts.name: account
docs: The account to initialize.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint this account will be associated with.

accounts.name: $(SysVarRentPubkey)
docs: Rent sysvar.

args.name: owner
docs: The new account's owner/multisignature.

instructions.name: SyncNative
docs: Given a wrapped / native token account (a token account containing SOL)
updates its amount field based on the account's underlying `lamports`.
This is useful if a non-wrapped SOL account uses `system_instruction::transfer`
to move lamports to a wrapped token account, and needs to have its token
`amount` field updated.

accounts.name: account
docs: The native token account to sync with its underlying lamports.
